workflow.name: Classify Intercom messages & route to ClickUp or Slack with GPT-4o-mini
workflow.description:
## How it works
This workflow automates the classification and routing of incoming Intercom conversations. When a new customer message arrives, it is analyzed by AI to determine category, sentiment, urgency, and tags. Based on this classification, the workflow creates tasks in ClickUp for Support or Product requests, or sends real-time alerts to Slack for Sales inquiries.

## Step-by-step

**Webhook Intake**

- Triggered when Intercom sends a new conversation payload.

- Captures customer details, message content, and metadata.

**AI Classification**

- Sends the conversation JSON to OpenAI (gpt-4o-mini) with a structured prompt.

- AI returns a JSON object with category (Support, Product, Sales, Other), sentiment, urgency, reasoning, and tags.

**Processing & Structuring**

- A Code node parses the AI output and merges it with conversation details.

- Prepares formatted task fields such as title, description, customer info, and priority.

**Conditional Routing**

- Support requests ‚Üí Task created in ClickUp with urgency and tags.

- Product requests ‚Üí Task created in ClickUp with structured details.

- Sales inquiries ‚Üí Slack alert sent to the Sales channel with context and AI reasoning.

- Other ‚Üí No task/action triggered.

## Benefits

- Automates Intercom ticket triage and routing in real time.

- Ensures consistent, AI-driven classification of all customer conversations.

- Reduces manual review time for Support, Product, and Sales teams.

- Creates structured tasks with enriched metadata for faster resolution.

- Keeps Sales teams instantly informed with Slack alerts for urgent leads.

parameters.text:
You are an AI assistant designed to analyze customer conversations from Intercom. Your task is to classify each conversation into structured fields for workflow automation.

Conversation: {{ $json["data"]["item"] }}

Based on the provided conversation JSON, respond ONLY with a valid JSON object in the following format:

{
  "category": "<Support | Product | Sales | Other>",
  "sentiment": "<Positive | Neutral | Negative>",
  "urgency": "<High | Medium | Low>",
  "reasoning": "<Brief explanation of how you classified it>",
  "tags": ["tag1", "tag2"]
}

Guidelines:
- "category": Determine the main topic. Use:
  - "Support" for help requests, bugs, technical issues, etc.
  - "Product" for feature requests, feedback, or UX issues.
  - "Sales" for pricing, demo, onboarding, or enterprise inquiries.
  - "Other" if it doesn't fit above.
- "sentiment": Analyze customer tone. Choose Positive, Neutral, or Negative.
- "urgency": 
  - High = frustrated users, urgent bug, blocked access.
  - Medium = requesting help soon, moderately concerned.
  - Low = casual inquiry, general feedback.
- "reasoning": Explain how you decided on the classification.
- "tags": Suggest 2‚Äì4 keywords as tags based on context (e.g., "billing", "login", "onboarding").

Only output valid JSON. Do NOT include explanations or extra text outside the JSON.

parameters.content:
## üì® 1. Webhook Intake

Purpose:

*Receives incoming conversation data from Intercom via a webhook (triggered on new messages).

Input:

Full conversation JSON
Customer name, email, and message content*

## ü§ñ 2. AI Classification Engine

How it works:

*The conversation is sent to an AI model with a prompt to classify it.

AI responds with a structured JSON containing:
category: Support | Product | Sales | Other
sentiment: Positive | Neutral | Negative
urgency: High | Medium | Low
reasoning: Explanation for classification
tags: Relevant keywords

A code node parses this AI output and merges it with user + conversation details to prepare for task creation or routing.*

## üîÄ 3. Conditional Routing

Logic:

*Each path checks the category returned by the AI.

Based on category, it routes the conversation to the appropriate action.*

## üìå 4. Action Handling üßæ 

**üßæSupport:**

Creates a ClickUp task with title, description, priority, and tags.

**üì¶ Product:**
Same as Support ‚Äì task created in ClickUp with relevant details.

**üì£ Sales:**
Sends a Slack message to the Sales team with AI's reasoning.

user.name: Avkash Kakdiya
user.bio:

üí° Specializing in agentic AI systems, content automation, sales funnels, and digital workers.
üîß 14+ years in tech | Building scalable no-code/low-code solutions using n8n, OpenAI, and other API-first tools.
üì¨ Let‚Äôs automate what slows you down.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
